channel.title: Get paid to modify clients
channel.description:
More info here:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,345848.msg2665281.html#post_client
I thought I would post it on this side of the forums because I doubt you guys would see it over there.

item.title: Get paid to modify clients
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

zachera:

I would also like to know what your purpose is here. Are you planning on making a download site which branches off from MoparScape? That would be really neat.

No, you will just be able to open up MoparScape, pick which version you want to use, and play it. Or of course server owners can link to moparscape for people to play on their servers.

Read full topic

item.title: Get paid to modify clients
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

I would also like to know what your purpose is here. Are you planning on making a download site which branches off from MoparScape? That would be really neat.

item.title: Get paid to modify clients
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

Moparisthebest:

PHP is implemented in C++, and again, while not the best practice, you could use C code with C++ as well.

i’ve tried ruby (no support for msvc), javascript (one decent lib but buggy) and im trying to use lua w/ luabind but im getting retardedly weird bugs

Read full topic

item.title: Get paid to modify clients
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

PHP is implemented in C++, and again, while not the best practice, you could use C code with C++ as well.

item.title: Get paid to modify clients
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:12, topic:343144”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=439542.msg3230995#msg3230995 date=1276052428]

I thought the idea was to have a bunch of people contributing rather than just one person. Put bounties out for plugins that implement various skills. Then encourage others to improve those plugins.

I can’t see how paying for one major server as being the right way to do things. Especially as you have so much talent that couldn’t contribute (okay fine: a million monkeys bashing at typewriters must be able to write something that compiles!).

its been tried and never worked out

Are you still writing that server I remember you talking about on IRC?

absolutely. turns out theres no good scripting interfaces for c++ so its been a pita
[/quote]

Scripting isn’t strictly REQUIRED, but it would make writing content easier for you too. I would think there would be great script engines for C++ as many scripting engines are actually implemented in C++.[/quote]
almost all are implemented in c. and scripting is definitely required

Read full topic

item.title: Get paid to modify clients
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:11, topic:343144”][quote author=Cain_ link=topic=439542.msg3230958#msg3230958 date=1276050752]

I thought the idea was to have a bunch of people contributing rather than just one person. Put bounties out for plugins that implement various skills. Then encourage others to improve those plugins.

I can’t see how paying for one major server as being the right way to do things. Especially as you have so much talent that couldn’t contribute (okay fine: a million monkeys bashing at typewriters must be able to write something that compiles!).

its been tried and never worked out

Are you still writing that server I remember you talking about on IRC?
[/quote]
absolutely. turns out theres no good scripting interfaces for c++ so its been a pita[/quote]

Scripting isn’t strictly REQUIRED, but it would make writing content easier for you too. I would think there would be great script engines for C++ as many scripting engines are actually implemented in C++.

Read full topic

item.title: Get paid to modify clients
item.dc:creator: @Rawr_monster_cookies Rawr monster cookies
item.description:
@Rawr_monster_cookies wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:343144”]It’s the community’s money and a standard in clients (an open-source standard) improves the community. So there is something in it for everyone.

It’s also not THAT easy of a task. It’s quite a few hours worth of work at least.[/quote]The thing I still actually do not understand is what you yourself are looking for… if you told me be easy money <3 hehe

shame nothing about rsc Hah still beta of the Area Editor tho

2128hmc.png1054×799

sku81l.png1054×799

Read full topic

item.title: Get paid to modify clients
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It’s the community’s money and a standard in clients (an open-source standard) improves the community. So there is something in it for everyone.

It’s also not THAT easy of a task. It’s quite a few hours worth of work at least.

Read full topic

item.title: Get paid to modify clients
item.dc:creator: @Rawr_monster_cookies Rawr monster cookies
item.description:
@Rawr_monster_cookies wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:7, topic:343144”]Can I ask why? Is there some kind of profit in it for you? $100 is quite a lot of money for a seemingly easy task…[/quote]Population on the website would actually grow IF the stuff is right, meaning… in the long run Moparisthebest would get more income each month of clicks and etc because of the user base that’s if any of them lazy asses just click the ads or get sponsor servers over at mopar

Read full topic

item.title: Get paid to modify clients
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“BAsh, post:4, topic:343144”]I thought the idea was to have a bunch of people contributing rather than just one person. Put bounties out for plugins that implement various skills. Then encourage others to improve those plugins.

I can’t see how paying for one major server as being the right way to do things. Especially as you have so much talent that couldn’t contribute (okay fine: a million monkeys bashing at typewriters must be able to write something that compiles!).[/quote]

The reason it is being done this way is that in the past a group of people getting together to write a server doesn’t work out. Of course a group can form to do it that way and then split the money up as they see fit after it is finished. I am only interested in paying for a completed server though instead of little parts at a time, since those are already plentiful.

edit:
Though the reason I posted this thread on this side of the forums was mainly the writing clients part, not the server contest. Although you could do any of them.

Read full topic

item.title: Get paid to modify clients
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

BAsh:

Mopar: the rs/bin/ version checker is broken.

I checked it, but it doesn’t appear to be broken. They just haven’t updated since then. The MD5’s are the same.

Anyway after someone releases the server to claim the money, I’ll probably put up the money to make a good updater, and with that a great bot can be made from cherokee.

Read full topic

item.title: Get paid to modify clients
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

Wow nice. While sure private servers are associated with newfaggery this scheme might actually work to increase code quality and feature set. That is of course assuming that strict code quality standards are adhered to…

Maybe this effort could crosspolinate a bot?

Currently we are at version 615 or so. It would be good for private servers to catch up. Mopar: the rs/bin/ version checker is broken. Perhaps you could now put up a bounty?

PS: Can we have stats on how much people are paying for the top spots and how much you have now?
http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php for those who can’t find the link.

Read full topic
